org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.core

Class Provider<T extends Data,S extends Data>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.core.Provider<T,S>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of input data.
    S - the type of output data.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AndroidProvider

    public abstract class Provider<T extends Data,S extends Data>
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides output data with given input data (if any). A provider may run asynchronously from the main data flow (e.g. TimerProvider) or may be called from an event from another component, like a Trigger, or from the UI.

    Please note that, unless differently specified, the provider will run on the main thread, thus the use of an AsyncProvider is highly encouraged.

    Inside the ExecutionManager, each provider is associated with an outputKey, which identifies in which Store to store the output from this provider. In case of multiple providers for the same outputKey, a Chooser must be defined within the ExecutionManager to choose between them on a per-request basis. Furthermore, every Provider is linked to the same progress Store, which is used to publish the current progress of the requests, such as errors, intermediate steps, final completion.

    NB: A single instance of a Provider may only output data on the same Store.

    Author:
    Riccardo Mancini
    See Also:
    ExecutionManager, Chooser, Trigger

      • attach

        void attach(ExecutionManager executionManager,
            java.lang.String providerKey,
            Store<S> outStore,
            Store<ProgressData> progressStore)
        Attaches this provider to the given ExecutionManager and @{link Store}s.
        Parameters:
        executionManager - the ExecutionManager this provider will be bound to.
        providerKey - the key of this provider in the ExecutionManager.
        outStore - the Store to be used for storing the output of this provider.
        progressStore - the Store to be used for storing the progress of this provider.
        See Also:
        onAttach(), detach()

      • getExecutionManager

protected ExecutionManager getExecutionManager()

      • publishProgress

        protected void publishProgress(long requestID,
                               int progress,
                               java.lang.String message)
        Notifies about current progress in the execution of the request. The progress update must refer to the whole request, of which this provider could be just an intermediate step.
        Parameters:
        requestID - the request id this progress refers to.
        progress - refer to ProgressData.progress
        message - refer to ProgressData.message
        See Also:
        publishProgresses(long, ProgressData...), #publishProgressThreadSafe(long, int, String), ProgressData

      • publishProgresses

        protected void publishProgresses(long requestID,
                                 ProgressData... progressData)
        Notifies about current progress in the execution of the request. The progress update must refer to the whole request, of which this provider could be just an intermediate step.
        Parameters:
        requestID - the request id this progress refers to.
        progressData - the progress data to be stored.
        See Also:
        publishProgress(long, int, String), #publishProgressesThreadSafe(long, ProgressData...), ProgressData

        data - the data to be stored.

        public void onAttach()

      • execute

        public abstract void execute(long requestID,
                             T... input)
        Provides output for the given input. This function must call publishResults(Data[]) or publishResults(long, Data[]) before returning.
        Parameters:
        requestID - the request id the given data refers to.
        input - the input data.
        See Also:
        publishResults(Data[]), publishResults(long, Data[]), executeCast(long, Data...)

      • executeCast

        public void executeCast(long requestID,
                        Data... input)
        Provides output for the given Data input. Input Data will be cast to T at runtime and passed to execute(long, Data[])
        Parameters:
        requestID - the request id the given data refers to.
        input - the input data.
        See Also:
        execute(long, Data[])
